net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.util

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.util.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used for declaring utility methods for files.
    Since:
    Apr 26, 2013 at 11:21:30 PM, v0.1
    Version:
    Jul 2, 2013 at 7:11:30 PM, v0.2
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

      Get the path after the directoryRelativeTo location.
      For example:
      getPathRelativeTo("C:/dir1/test/file53.txt", "/test/") would return "file53.txt"

      Get the preceding path before the directory's location.

      getPrecedingPath("C:/dir1/test/file53.txt", "/test/") would return "C:/dir1"

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        public static boolean delete(java.io.File file)
        Delete the specified file from the Operating System's file system. If the file is a directory and contains other files, recursively delete the contents of the directory.
        Parameters:
        file - The File instance to dele from the OS's file system.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the file was successfully deleted.

      • getParentFolder

        public static java.lang.String getParentFolder(java.lang.String location)
        Get the parent directory of the location given.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to get the parent folder of.
        Returns:
        The parent folder's location.

      • removeEndingSlashes

        public static java.lang.String removeEndingSlashes(java.lang.String location)
        Remove any of the ending forward slashes from the String Object given.
        Parameters:
        location - The String instance to remove the ending forward slashes from.
        Returns:
        A new String containing the String without ending forward slashes.

      • getFileName

        public static java.lang.String getFileName(java.lang.String location)
        Get the name of the file at the given location.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the file to get the name of.
        Returns:
        The file's name without the preceding path.

      • getFileNameWithoutExtension

        public static java.lang.String getFileNameWithoutExtension(java.lang.String location)
        Get the name of the file at the given location without its file extension (if it contains one).
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the file to get the name of.
        Returns:
        The file's name without the preceding path and extension.

      • removeExtension

        public static java.lang.String removeExtension(java.lang.String location)
        Remove the extension from the specified String instance.
        Parameters:
        location - The String instance to remove the extension from.
        Returns:
        The location without the extension.

      • getPrecedingPath

        public static java.lang.String getPrecedingPath(java.lang.String path,
                                java.lang.String directoryRelativeTo)
        Get the preceding path before the directory's location.
        For example:
        getPrecedingPath("C:/dir1/test/file53.txt", "/test/") would return "C:/dir1"
        Parameters:
        path - The path to get the preceding path from.
        directoryRelativeTo - The directory to split the path at and get the preceding location from.
        Returns:
        The preceding path before the directoryRelativeTo location.

      • getPathRelativeTo

        public static java.lang.String getPathRelativeTo(java.lang.String path,
                                 java.lang.String directoryRelativeTo)
        Get the path after the directoryRelativeTo location.
        For example:
        getPathRelativeTo("C:/dir1/test/file53.txt", "/test/") would return "file53.txt"
        Parameters:
        path - The path to get the location relative to.
        directoryRelativeTo - The directory to get the path after.
        Returns:
        The path that is relative to both parameters.

      • readFile

        public static java.lang.String[] readFile(java.lang.String location)
        Read the text from a File and store it in a String array.
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the file to read from.
        Returns:
        A String array filled with each line in order.

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(java.lang.String location,
             java.lang.String text)
        Write the specified text to the file at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the file to write to.
        text - The text to write to the file.

      • getAbsolutePath

        public static java.lang.String getAbsolutePath(java.lang.String location)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Get the absolute path of a file given the path (relative or absolute) of a file.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the file to get the absolute path to.
        Returns:
        The absolute path to the file at the specified location.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is an error finding the file.
